description: The scene depicts ancient Egyptian pyramid construction, with laborers pulling a massive stone block on a cart while a taskmaster supervises. Two figures in historical attire observe the immense undertaking. The absurdity lies in one observer's comment, which reveals his primary concern is whether this monumental effort will somehow keep his razor blades sharp. This juxtaposes the grandeur of a historical feat with a trivial, modern personal inconvenience, highlighting a profound lack of perspective.
caption: Well, if it'll keep my razor blades sharp, that's all I ask.
